experience.title: Senior Research Manager
responsibilities: Oversee Scientists conducting predictive modeling, reliability-validity analyses, and natural language processing studies in Python and R to evaluate equitable assessments for Higher Education.
Manage 41 research engagements with academic collaborators resulting in 23 conference presentations, 5 manuscript submissions, and 31 Continuous Quality Improvement (CQI) consultation reports.
Administer, distribute, and support $100,000 annual grant for research in education selection.
Obtained $90,000 in Mitacs funding across three projects.

experience.title: Researcher
responsibilities: Work directly with faculty and clinicians developing rehabilitation technologies.
Designed, built and implemented a ‘Biofeedback enhanced, active video games for kids with cerebral palsy’.
Conducted feature engineering and data processing turning biosignal data into rehabilitation games  (MATLAB, R, Python), improving mobility by 12% and strength by 18% in children with disabilities.
Conducted regular user-design sessions and in-home evaluations in France and Canada with clients, clinicians, and scientists for new health technologies.
Led academic and community publication, overseeing researcher staff and students during development resulting in 10 academic publications, 10 community engagements, and 9 conference presentations.

patents.name: Computer System and Method for Cognitive Tests for Scalable Precision Education
Natural Language Processing for Quality Assurance for Constructed-Response Tests
Ability-based balancing for Exercise Video Games
